metadata.title: Wednesday, 23rd September, 2015
metadata.session: FIFTH SESSION OF THE ELEVENTH ASSEMBLY

questions.minister: Minister of Commerce, Trade and Industry
parts: (a)    whether the Government has any plans to encourage value addition industries for agricultural products;
(b)    if so, what the plans are; and
(c)    what incentives, if any, have been provided to entrepreneurs who seek to venture in value addition projects.

questions.minister: Minister of Information and Broadcasting what the progress on the improvement of radio reception in most rural areas, is.
Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education
parts: (a)    why the National Institute for Scientific and Industrial Research (NISIR) has had no management board for the last two years;
(b)    when a board will be appointed;
(c)    how many institutions under the Ministry operate without management boards;
(d)    what the names of the institutions are; and
(e)    when management boards will be appointed for the institutions at (c).

questions.minister: Minister of Local Government and Housing when construction of additional staff houses for Mpongwe District Council will commence.
Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education
parts: (a)    when the construction of laboratories at the following secondary schools in Chasefu Parliamentary Constituency will commence:
(i)    Lusuntha Day; (ii)    Hoya Day; and (iii)    Emusa Day;
(b)    what the total cost of the projects is; and
(c)    who the contractors for the projects are.
(a)    when the construction of the New Mushili Health Centre in Bwana Mkubwa Parliamentary Constituency will commence;
(b)    what the cost of the project is; and
(c)    what the time-frame for the project is.

questions.minister: Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication
parts: (a)    when the construction of the Tandabale-Simwaba-Naleza-Kalama-Mabanga road in Magoye Parliamentary Constituency, which was abandoned by the contractor in 2014, will resume;
(b)    what the total cost of the project is;
(c)    what the cost of the outstanding works is; and
(d)    what the time-frame for the remaining works is.

questions.minister: Minister of Mines, Energy and Water Development
parts: (a)    whether the Government has any plans to connect the following areas in Rufunsa District to the national electricity grid:
(i)    Chinyunyu; (ii)    Sinjela; (iii)    Chitemalesa; and (iv)    Mwachilele;
(b)    what the estimated cost of the project is; and
(c)    if there are no such plans, why.
(a)    why Milenge District has no fertilizer and seed depot thereby making it difficult for farmers to access inputs;
(b)    when a depot will be established in the District; and
(c)    what measures have been taken, in the interim, to ensure that farmers have easy access to inputs.

questions.minister: Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication
parts: (a)    how much money, in total, was owed to all road contractors country-wide as of June, 2015;
(b)    what the total number of contractors owed, is;
(c)    how much interest had accrued on principal amounts as of August, 2015; and
(d)    whether all the contractors were within their contract periods of completing the projects.

questions.minister: Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education
parts: (a)    how many teachers were working in Government schools in Kalabo District as of July, 2015;
(b)    of the teachers above, how many were:
(i)    confirmed; and (ii)    not confirmed; and
(c)    what the cause of the delay in confirming the teachers is.
(a)    whether the Government has any plans to construct a Cancer Diseases Hospital in the Copperbelt Province to cater for patients in the northern part of the country;
(b)    if so, when the plans will be implemented; and
(c)    if there are no such plans, why.

questions.minister: Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication
parts: (a)    why the palaces of Senior Chief Kasempa and Chief Ingwe in Kasempa District were not considered for construction of communication towers under Phase I;
(b)    which other Senior Chiefs’ palaces, country-wide, were not considered;
(c)    whether priority for construction of towers under Phase II will be given to the palaces at (a); and
(d)    if the palaces at (a) will not be given priority, why.

questions.minister: Minister of Mines, Energy and Water Development
parts: (a)    what corporate social responsibility activities the Zambezi River Authority has done in Gwembe District from 2012 to 2014; and
(b)    what the total cost of the activities undertaken is.

questions.minister: Minister of Chiefs and Traditional Affairs
parts: (a)    when the boundary dispute between Chief Malembeka in the Copperbelt Province and Senior Chief Chipepo in the Central Province will be resolved; and

(b)    what measures have been taken to address chiefdom boundary disputes country-wide. ORDER OF THE DAY 1    Thanks - His Excellency the President’s Address – Motion (22nd September) - Resumption of Debate. _________________________
